name: places/ChIJZ-wCRohYwokRvnOFofo8F7A
adrFormatAddress: 2175 Broadway, New York, NY 10024, USA

editorialSummary.text: Ornate 1903 hotel with low-key, wood-floored rooms, plus a trendy lounge & free Wi-Fi.

originalText.text: The location was great! Walkable to the train and to Central Park. It was also a nice room with clean comfortable beds.  The bakery attached is good and the vouchers were a nice touch.  Housekeeping came every day and did a great job.  My only complaint was that there was a slight draft coming in the bathroom window, so the bathroom got a bit cold. Other than that, a great experience and I would definitely stay again

text.text: The location was great! Walkable to the train and to Central Park. It was also a nice room with clean comfortable beds.  The bakery attached is good and the vouchers were a nice touch.  Housekeeping came every day and did a great job.  My only complaint was that there was a slight draft coming in the bathroom window, so the bathroom got a bit cold. Other than that, a great experience and I would definitely stay again

originalText.text: I don’t think I’ll ever stay anywhere else!  Hotel Belleclaire is such a gem.  The rooms are beautifully clean and comfortable.  The price is reasonable.  The people at the front desk are extremely friendly and kind.  The room rate gives you vouchers for free breakfast at the French bakery downstairs. The shower is clean and the water comes out strong and hot.  Just a few blocks away from Lincoln Center and the Hudson.  There is no street noise and the sleep is quiet.  Every time I come back to NY, this is where I will stay. As a boutique hotel, there is no coffee service or microwave in the room.

originalText.text:
Excellent location. Public transportation nearby. Super clean. The staff was really nice

The rooms are a bit small but if you are the type of person who only goes to the hotel to have a nice sleep, the room definitely works

The “complementary” breakfast is just bakery and juice, I wouldn’t call it it breakfast

text.text:
Excellent location. Public transportation nearby. Super clean. The staff was really nice

The rooms are a bit small but if you are the type of person who only goes to the hotel to have a nice sleep, the room definitely works

The “complementary” breakfast is just bakery and juice, I wouldn’t call it it breakfast

originalText.text:
We were unfortunately disappointed by our experience here. My boyfriend and I were gifted a stay here for Christmas and we were super excited about the hotel and the neighborhood. When we got there the room was super tiny, and I noticed over the course of our two days there that everything felt a little damp for some reason. I literally aired out all of my clothing at our next stop and immediately felt cleaner. I did do a bedbug check and found nothing, so I'm confident the hotel isn't unclean, but we did find some kind of millipede like but in our bathroom the second morning, so there was moisture coming from somewhere.

I really liked the bakery attached, and I think providing vouchers for breakfast is a nice idea, but the line backed up so far down the hallway it made getting coffee such a production. I had to build in 30-40 minutes just to make use of our vouchers, and I felt super bad for the bakery staff going through that every morning.

Overall we didn't hate it, but we were speaking with the person that gifted us the stay and they told us they had booked an upgraded suite, but it seems that we were given a standard room. That, or a queen suite is just really really tiny. And honestly I don't mind a tiny room, but the ventilation got to me.

That, or a queen suite is just really really tiny. And honestly I don't mind a tiny room, but the ventilation got to me.

originalText.text: Had a lovely stay here. Safe area right near a subway stop that takes you to all the major tourist spots. The hotel was clean and quiet and the staff are friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again!
